description: Named after Anthony Comstock (1844–1915) (and the Comstock laws which he propagated) + -ery, coined in an editorial in The New York Times in 1895 and famously adopted by George Bernard Shaw in 1905.

entries.meaning: (US) Censorship of literature and performances because of especially broad definitions of obscenity or immorality.
examples: Comstockery is the world's standing joke at the expense of the United States.
